CatDescriptText: Miss Margaret Ptomey, clerk in state auditor general department, 6939 Kelly St., was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in the Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, April 25, 1959, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think those receiving Mother's Assistance should be required to report to the proper authorities just how all of the grant is spent, or should the present latitude in spending it be permitted to continue?" answer reads: "Not necessarily. If they are eligible for public assistance there should not be any question as to how they spend the money.  If the money is not being spent right then it is up to the case workers to find it out."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Margaret Ptomey wearing line patterned blouse, holding newspaper, standing in front of Empire Building, Liberty Avenue, Downtown
